title: Type 1 Throttle Tube Cable Roller. *NEW PRODUCTS*

posts.content:
73 Aircooled Throttle Tube Cable Roller

I've machined my own throttle tube cable roller for a Hex bar linkage to eliminate the cable snag.

Bracket is machined from aluminium, with a stainless steel guide roller. Fitted with a 8mm diameter stainless tube to run through the fan housing, replacing the standard throttle tube. Comes supplied with a No 6 stainless self tapper to secure to the fan housing. The fan housing will need a 2.5mm hole drilled into it to attach the bracket (drill bit not supplied).

Delivery times will vary. Please add your name to the list to register your interest.

UK price is £37 each including recorded delivery, EU price is €60 for tracked & signed Airmail (Paypal Gift Payment Only Please)

Although these have been tested, I cannot guarantee fit will be 100% due to variations in hole positions & alignment in tin ware.

Please note: The holes in the tinware need to be in line to keep the tube straight as VW intended. You may need to address these issues before hand.

You can now also find me on Facebook at 73 Aircooled

All rollers supplied from 01/09/14 will be the latest revised version 4, as below



Roller assembly parts in limited edition black





Examples




UPDATE

After fitting a roller to Coops' bus last week, I came across a small issue not with the unit itself but the way in which his original tube had been made to fit misaligned tinware holes by the engine builder. As I have stated on page one of the thread the holes should ideally be made to be in line to keep the cable pull as straight as possible.

If your tube looks remotely like this - it shouldn't!



I was able to get over this by removing my tube & fitting the original one. Otherwise it would have been engine out to align the holes.

Something else to be aware of. Some engines do not seem to have the rubber flexi conduit fitted between the exit of the cable tube (at the chassis) and the throttle tube at the back of the engine. As far as I'm aware there's no repro version available, but a Beetle conduit will fit - this is fitted to my bus. This piece helps keep the cable in line and clean (photos to follow).

Conduit part http://www.machine7.com/product.php?xPr ... 0&xSec=817

All future units will only use a 4mm grub screw to secure the tube to the body for ease of removal, in case your only option is to use your original tube. The roller pin will also now be held in place with a grub screw from the back, making it easier to be removed if required.



NEW PRODUCTS* Short Tube Roller, Block Off/Coil Clamp, 123 Dizzy Clamp, Dellorto Linkage Arms.



Now available is a short tube version for Bergman/Porsche fan kits, come with stainless M4 mounting hardware. £37 inc delivery



Fuel pump block offs with coil clamp. These are available plain (as shown) or with a 1/4, 3/8, 1/2 NPT or BSP vented outlet. These are made to order @£40 + delivery.





123 billet Dizzy clamp, designed to fit the shaft with a deeper clamping ring surface, this grips securely unlike some other clamps available. This will only fit a 123 as the main shaft diameter protrudes higher out of the case than a 009. It may work with a Mallory but I've not got one available to test the fit with. Comes with stainless clamp screw & M8 CSP nut to fit locate into recess. £35 made to order.







Dellorto Linkage arms, machined from billet 316 stainless with a 4.5mm wide locating flat that has the correct fit on the shaft unlike a universal CB mount, eliminating all play. Made to order £25 inc delivery. I will also have a weber version available soon.

Very nice, too late for me as jbe fitted with buttys linkage. Well worth it, good product.

Marvelwear wrote:
Very nice, too late for me as jbe fitted with buttys linkage. Well worth it, good product.


You can still run it with Buttys linkage, as I do. This is for engine bay, Buttys is up front. This just makes it even smoother.
Interested but concerned that over time the cable will cut into the roller. Are you able to supply spare rollers?

Karl_F wrote:
Marvelwear wrote:
Very nice, too late for me as jbe fitted with buttys linkage. Well worth it, good product.


You can still run it with Buttys linkage, as I do. This is for engine bay, Buttys is up front. This just makes it even smoother.

I HAVE BUTTYS LINKAGE AND A JOE BENCE ENTERPRISE ROLLER TUBE FITTED? If Jonny cj had not picked these up for me Id have had one of yours as with the new linkage and roller tube its very smooth and I can run with less springs so less wear on throttle spindles on weber Ict's:-)very close to mine http://www.jbevw.com/products . Good luck, these should fly.

Slippers wrote:
Interested but concerned that over time the cable will cut into the roller. Are you able to supply spare rollers?


Spare roller won't be an issue, as long as I'm alive! Personally don't think there will be any problems as Acetol is very hard wearing & the cable & roller are working in action together, unlike the cutting action of a cable at the end of the tube. If there any any issues I will exchange the unit for a replacement.

I have edited the post to supply a stainless roller versions for £35.
Thanks for the reply, could you please add my name to the list as I don't have a clue how to do it. (Stainless roller)

I also have the jbe version. If you have a hex linkage buy this bit of kit, you will be amazed at how much smoother it will make the pedal action. The good thing is that now you don't have to pay postage then get raped by customs for the tax
Well done for making these dude.
You might find you need to pull the throttle cable through a bit more so the grub screw ends up on the cable instead of the cast bit on the end. If it does just pack it out with a split pin then do up the grub screw.

Cheers, Lee.
